abstract_summ: Electrospun membranes containing curcumin were prepared from poly(L-co-D,L-lactic) acid and polyvinylpyrrolidone . The biomaterials showed antibacterial activity against pathogenic microorganisms such as Staphylococcus aureus and Candida albicans . In-vitro experiments against tumor cells and white blood cells revealed potential biomedical application of the membranes .
